Cute location next to all the cafes and bistros in South Park. Perhaps that's why the name is in French?
author: Natalie T.

description: The burritos are enormous. The grill items are pretty good, too. I like the shrimp quesadilla. They'll make every to your specification, which is great for me because I am ridiculously picky about Mexican food. I hate cilantro. I know, weird. But, it is what it is. I often get a side of tofu and a side of beans and eat them sans the tortilla, sour cream and other fat-laden accouterments. They have fancy sugar-laden sodas in glass bottles, too. It's often crowded at lunch time but well worth the wait.
author: Maren P.

description:
mexico au parc is packed at noon, but the line goes pretty quick and there is usually a place to sit if you wish to eat there.

They make a decent taco and burrito, but you may want to try their caesar or tostada salad.
author: Helen J.

description: Just got back from this place with a co-worker and I must say  40 notches above Chavo's. I ordered the super veggie burrito, it was so creamy with my black beans,lettuce and guac/pico mixture topped off with a mixture of spicy salsas. I even enjoyed the tortilla which I normally throw away, while I eat my meal Atkin's style..We got there a little before 12 and the place was packed with a mini line forming outside the place..not too hard considering its a tiny, yet cosy space. We were ordering for 6 people and I think the server got a little aggravated because of the line behind me..next time I go there I'll be sure to order ahead of time. I'm a little bummed I forgot to order the flan but there's always a next time!!!
author: Amruta G.

description: Mexico Au Parc serves up my favorite meal --- carne asada super burrito with black beans and mild salsa, chips and guacamole on the side. The space inside is limited, and it's often packed full during lunch hour on a weekday. If it's a sunny day, take your order to go and sit outside on one of the benches in the park.
author: Elliot J.

description: This is a better than average lunchtime option. I usually get the prawn quesadilla. And, on a nice day, I get it to-go and eat it in the park with my dog (who I heartlessly give none of it to).
author: Amanda S.

description: This is my new favourite place to go for lunch, great freshly made authentic mexican food at good prices.  Beware the Super Burrito though - I feel about 200 pounds heavier after eating it.  Small portions are certainly not a problem here!
author: Planet K.

description:
their burritos are alright. the chicken quesadillas are better, but nothing to write home about.

the spice bar is a nice touch. it used to be that you'd have to ask them to give you container after container and they'd charge you accordingly.

the ladies behind the counter are efficient if they can understand your order. 

the lady behind the cash register has never smiled at me. i don't think her smile muscles work. blah to her. crabby mc crabby.

i wouldn't call it cheap, but that's because i think a $5.00 burrito should include free quacamole and sour cream. hey, i'm cheap like that. but not for the honeyz.

the best seats are at the window so you can open them up to get fresh air. sitting inside makes your clothes stink.

i'd like to give them only 1 star, since it's nothing too special, except that it's located in south park. buy your grub and take it outside to eat. and get fresh air. just watch out for the dog poop cakes.

rating: one grease bucket and one emply plastic bucket
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: Mexico au Parc is delicious, cheap, and full of cheerful employees! Bonus: get tomato, spinach, or whole wheat varieties on tortilla! Take outside for a meal on the bench in the park. Love to come here for lunch :)
author: Elise H.

description: I love this place.  This is my favorite burrito place in South Market.
author: Brandon B.

description: HUGE burritos and a great selection, next time I know to pay attention to the choices of tortillas, meats, and sauces.  South Park is always a great destination for lunch.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
+/-1 - the taco salad. gut buster, perfect for a Friday lunch with coworkers... but can put you into a food coma... eek
2 - the large salsa table with about 6 different types of salsas
3 - real silverware
4 - it feels like a dirty little secret but I'm pretty sure its not so much of a secret for anyone who works in SOMA
5 - they're fast an efficient, don't let the line out the door turn you away, there's always a table ready for you right when you need it.
author: Alice H.

description: Went there again today and had another great shrimp quesadilla.  The line was even longer than usual today, but it moved pretty fast.  Very worth going there again.
author: moosedog i.

description: I go here about three times a week.  The burritos are large, they rarely skimp on the meat, there's a salsa bar, and it's tasty.  Big Pirv and Kari love this place and they think it ranks up there with Farolito and La Taqueria but they are wrong.  It's good but it's not that good.
author: Steven M.

description: Good burritos, friendly staff. Cheap-like-Mission, and good salsas. When I think Au Parc, I think "three stars", but that's just because I've eaten there so many times.
author: Blaine C.

description: Fairly decent Mexican food. I think it's authentic and they wrap it so well when you get it to go that it stays hot & fresh, even in the rain. Nice, extensive menu. As always, I recommend the al pastor burrito!
author: Colleen B.

description: Been back a couple of times. Found out the one area that is worthwhile on the menu are items from the grill...made fresh and much better than the warming tray gunk. Still not outstanding, but good every now and again.
author: Nick V.

description: I've had the lunch here a couple of times and I wasn't that impressed. Now the breakfast is another story. First, there's no line. Second they have delicious breakfast options for dirt cheap! I always get the huevos la mexicana either in plate form or in a burrito and it's under $5, AND I literally stay full all day. No refill need at lunch time lol.
author: Holly E.

description: One of the better taquerias around the SOMA area.  Used to frequent this place for lunch during work and the line is often out the door, but moves quickly.  The sopes and cochinita are two of the best things on the menu.  Or the shrimp fajita burrito.  It's also great on a warm afternoon to take your meal across the street and sit on the grass or benches of South Park.
author: Curtis C.

description: They named it something other than "Taqueria" or "Mexican Food" ? I dont get it, thats my favorite part because you know a place has to be awesome when the name of the restaurant is what they're selling. One of the better taqueria's I've been to recently.  I always judge mexican food based on their burritos, specifically their carne asada and i was impressed. Very tasty and a good amount. I love free chips so this place got an extra star for that.
author: Mike B.

description: This is an excellent lunch place in South Park offering what I think are the best Tostadas in town!
author: Maria L.

description: Oh yeah burritos and enchiladas... these guys are no screwing around. The line out the door at lunch time proves it. Decently fast service, so don't sweat the line. Get there, get some.
author: David R.

description:
Love going here for a quick lunch. 
Get here early because the line gets long!

I highly recommend the Azteca burrito.  It's huge and awesome. 
Quesadilla's are great too. 
I honest;y have been eating here for 4 years now and haven't had anything I didn't like. 
A must have for anyone near South Park.
author: David L.

description: They get the fourth star for the mole verde. yum. The burritos will sit like a brick in your stomach, so go for a sope, or a tostada. Do not go in the morning unless you have time to spare - It takes a Loooooooong time to make a breakfast burrito.
author: Julia P.

description: I probably hit up Mexico Au Parc about once a week and am never disappointed. The super burritos are STUFFED with your choice of beans, meats, veggies and other typical toppings and I am always really full (some how I can never stop eating, even when Im full). These giant burritos cost less than $7.00 and you always get chips and salsa (even if you get it to go). The line is long at lunch, but quick.
author: Chris M.

description: Wow. I never thought I would find a decent taqueria in South Park, especially a cheap one. This place was a pleasant suprise. I work around the corner and love coming here for  a super tofu taco and then eating it out under the trees next to all the dog poop in the grass.
author: Mark H.

description: I like this place. I can't really say any more than anyone else has at this point. So yeah. Good burritos.
author: josh r.

description: A very good deal for the quality of the food. The place is often packed at lunch time (no tables), but the park is there to enjoy your lunch. The little salsa bar is a nice plus.
author: Steph S.

description: Mexico au Parc is a more-than-decent burrito joint which looks out on South Park. Their most notable feature is the variety of meat offered - everything from carnitas to pibil, several kinds of chicken, and more traditional carne asada. I opted for a carnitas burrito "Azteca" style (smothered in cheese, enchilada sauce, guacamole, and salsa). The pork was moist and delicious, the guac was chunky and flavorful, and it was all around tasty.
author: Jason M.

description: Affordable and fast.  Even when there's a line out the door, it seems like you're in and out of there like there was no line.   Coke in glass bottles!!  But I think the best thing about this place is the breakfast!  For under 5 bucks, you can get a 3 egg omelette, with potatoes!! I've never been able to finish it, its so much food!
author: Joey R.

description: I'd be so mean not to give this place 5 stars as I eat here almost every day. It's always good, always fresh. Maybe it's not the absolute best burrito in town but it's honest chow served with a smile. There's always a huge line at lunchtime but it moves fast. Regulars' tip: You don't have to line up for quesadillas, go straight to the grill. But why would you eat a pound of melted cheese when you can eat a burrito.
author: mefloquine x.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunch.  The line moves quickly and overall the staff seems very efficient.  I ordered a burrito with carnitas.  It was good.  The portion size was large and the flavors were distinct and fresh.  The carnitas could have been a little better, but it wasn't bad and they gave you plenty of it.  I also ordered a tamale which I would rate a 2.5 out of 5 - fresh tasting, but lacking in flavor - boring.  The burrito alone will bring me back for more.
author: X X.

description: There are days when there could be nothing better than going to Mexico au Parc, picking up a Burrito and an imported coke, and swinging merrily on the swing set  while I eat my burrito... That'll cure any number of work-related ills!
author: Wil E.

description: Good food in a cool little neighborhood.  Definitely a business lunch crowd, myself among them.  Take your order and eat it in the park, couldn't be a better break from the office.  I reccommend getting your burrito smothered in salsa and melted cheese if you're not taking it to go, excellent.
author: Vince T.

description: the carne asada nachos are pretty good..the burrito is decent. overall it's an ok place for lunch. does get pretty busy.  it's so close to work i cant complain too much.
author: Craig I.

description:
For South of Market, the Mexican food is pretty good. I will say though, that I'm really not that enthused by the food. Its decent and you can go eat in South Park which is a big bonus. All the Mexican in the South Beach/South Park area is pretty marginal.

I'll give it another shot when its not packed and can enjoy the experience a bit more.
author: David T.

description: Solid Mexican food for the price, geared to the Soma work crowd. The regular bar is great and all, but my personal tip is to go to the grill. It's a separate line, just walk up and talk to the woman manning it by the cash register. Get a fajita super burrito or a Chicken Mushroom Quesadilla. They're heaven. This adds about 10 minutes if they're busy, but you can call it in in advance.
author: Scott D.

description:
I go here for working lunches.  The meat preperations are a bit timid, and the prices, while affordable for the neighborhood, are quite high for the food category.  The self-serve salsas are reasonably good.  And if you're willing to wait for the grill-time products (such as anything al pastor), you get a better experience.

It's decent, but not what i'd call especially good.
author: Joshua R.

description: The staff are friendly, and this IS a burrito place I can walk to from work, which rates a star on its own.  That said, the burritos are just ok, kinda bland.  To be fair I am a little bit of a burrito snob, and a pescatarian which rules out 3/4 of the menu for me.   The super veggie was not as big as i'm used to and for the first time ever in my entire life I just tossed the butt end, rather than try to finish or save for later...   Its just up the street from work, however so I did return after getting a super veggie that was only so-so.  I tried one of the dinner options for lunch the 2nd time through, figured if I was spending more like $10 I might as well get a whole meal...So I did the cheese enchiladas with black beans and rice, and liked that much more than the soggy somewhat flavorless super veggie.  The staff is friendly, and its the only burrito accesible from work, but I'd say go with a dinner option or some kind of quesadilla thing..and load up on the extra salsa cuz the food is a bit whited out.
author: RJ M.

description:
I'm here at least 3 times a week.  Its in South Park and it just looks expensive from the outside but its very, very reasonable.  

I usually just get a simple bean + rice + salsa + extra cilantro burrito w/chips.  Total is less than $4 and it is yummy.  Great salsa bar covering a range from sweet to tangy.  I usually bring the burrito back to work and top it off with a little of the XXX Yucateco (the brown sauce).  Perfect.

I also go with the Tofu Ranchero, which is also pretty tasty.

They also do a great job of serving people in a hurry.  Even with the line running out on to the street, which is the norm around lunch, you'll have your chips + salsa + burrito in hand in less than 5 mins.
author: Scott M.

description: eh...kind of bueno? the chili relleno was OK. that's three stars. the chili verde, however, was chicken noodle soup, sans soup. ¿dónde está el cerdo? three minus one equals dos estrellas.
author: David D.

description: Divine!  Burritos are excellent. They are huge. Salsa Bar,,, a huge plus! Only negative is the hours of operation....wishing they stayed open for dinner a few nights a week and weekends too!
author: Julie G.

description: OK, I am Swedish and we basically don't get good burritos in Sweden. This place was the first one I tried in SF and it still is my favourite. Sure, I've learned how to order the stuff now, but I still feel like the burrito n00b I once was everytime I come here. In that good, excited way. Really gonna miss this place when I am 9 hours ahead of SF...
author: Linda M.

description: People. This is South Park. In San Francisco. Quit whining about the prices, or hop on BART to the Mission. For $8 you can get a very decent, quite large, customizable burrito, with free chips and access to a salsa bar. I haven't tried a ton of the meat fillings, but the tofu is pretty great, and it's what I usually stick to. I've had the big ass burrito covered in sauce, the name of which escapes me right now, but is really delicious, and the kind of meal where your productivity is going to go way downhill afterward. Seriously, after ingesting this mother you're going to want to launch yourself into a siesta full force. Anyway, the staff is nice and friendly, especially the gentleman who usually works the cash register. Despite being super crowded at lunchtime, service is super fast, and even if it's hard to get a table, it's nicer to eat in the park anyway.
author: Tammy C.

description:
hmm yummie burritos.  i haven't tried anything else outside of that but they're so good i'm hesitant to try anything else.  they're pretty giant too and i've never been able to finish a whole one so it's good to split one with someone else.

i think their biggest con is that there's always a line.  i mean they're pretty quick, i always see atleast 4 people making orders.  but i can never figure out what time the lunch crowd swings but to avoid the lines.
author: Eliza C.

description: I must say, finding decent, edible, semi-authentic Mexican food has been difficult for me to find in my area (near the ballpark) and it was refreshing to finally discover Mexico au Parc.   The women there withstood and even found humor in my butchered attempt to order my entire meal in Spanish which is not necessary because they do speak English quite well (this made the situation even more hilarious).  I ordered the Al Pastor (Shepherd Style bbq pork) and unlike other similar Mexican restaurants this was actually prepared in front of me (cut from a rotisserie, grilled lightly, added requested spices) and tasted delicious and quite similar to when I actually had it in Mexico.   For being in SOMA I expected this place to mirror what I loathe and that is 'American-ized' Mexican food (this goes for Asian places as well) and it proved to be quite the opposite.  This place is great for grabbing a tasty over-sized burrito along with a good bottle o' Mexican Cola and sitting in the quaint Southpark area (a highlight amongst the constant obnoxious construction)
author: Brian M.

description: i'm picky about my mexican food. for real. i'm from los angeles and am used to a certain kind of mexican---you know, where everything in the burrito is nicely mixed together, the guac is amazing, and the sauces the meat stews in should be poured over everything. i'm not a big fan of mission mexican, but i can get behind this place. the pork was AMAZING and the burrito enough for two meals. it also helps that you can walk over to the park to eat and feel like youre not in a city.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
fast. cheap. good.

cafeteria style.  the super taco with chicken mole is a meal for me.  

5th star for selling mexican bottled coke with sugar as opposed to corn syrup.
author: megan g.

description: Mmm. Quesadillas are fast and you can skip to the grill.
author: John K.

description:
omfg, chorizo breakfast burrito with black beans, hot salsa and no cheese, you light up my life!

for $4.61 including tax, this is tastiest most filling breakfast available in south park. the burritos here are always tautly wrapped and of the perfect circumference. nonchalantly alternating typing with bites? no spillage, no problem.

this place also scores major points for nailing my office's order of 14 burritos and tacos with various dietary constraints -- in 20 minutes. my favorite? the burrito without the tortilla.

plus, if you're riding the organic/anti-high fructose corn syrup wave that's sweeping the great nation of california, you'll find the authentic glass-bottled cokes here to be a real treat. 39 sinfully gratifying grams of sugar, not HFCS.
author: Mia L.

description: great salsa (the verde was really hot last week, dunno what up with that), great shrimp quesadillas. the weird thing ordering a quesadilla at Au Parc is you're subjected to this weird routing conundrum where first you cut in front of everyone in the burrito line to order form the grill, you PAY, and then you wait, right where the two lines intersect, so you are basically forced to hover by the register, blocking everyone's way as they try to pay for burritos. but the food is worth it so who cares, and you can eat in the park.
author: John M.

description: the chile relleno burrito was ok, but somehow the flavors became mal instead of que bueno. the horchata is dependable, plus, you get the strange feeling your in some little residential neighborhood and not SOMA.
author: Bee H.

description: good for grilled veggie burritos (super)...that way you can cut all those people lined up out the door!!! since i can't get down to the mission, this place does the trick.
author: Danielle Y.

description: Really nice little spot close to where I live. It's not as dive-y as El Farolito, and definitely a lot cleaner. The prices aren't as cheap as what you'd find in the Mission, but the location is worth it. The salsa is fresh and really delicious - the tomato to water ratio is higher than at other places. The only way to have a burrito here is Azteca - which means they put enchilada sauce on top, along with sour cream and guacamole. YUM! However, the burritos are smaller than what I'm used to, and the meat is a little lacking in flavor.
author: Charrylenne S.

description: not the best.  decent FAST mexican food in the south park area.
author: kulas a.

description: when you first start working in the neighborhood, you find out about this place as one of the better mexican food spots around, and you go, and you laugh at how ridiculously honkey-food this place is.  but the longer you work in the neighborhood with unchecked mexican food quality, you begin to convince yourself its pretty good, and then even start ordering tofu burritos.  my dad grew up in the pink house on the corner across the park in south park near this spot so i took him to this place for lunch once, and he told me it was pretty ok. 3 stars, definately as good as it gets for mexican food at lunch in soma/southpark/at&t pac bell park area.
author: christopher a.

description: This is a nice mexican place in the Soma. They have decent burritos. They have this super burrito where they put sauce and cheese all over the burrito. Very yummy.
author: David S.

description: In an area that became very popular during the dot-com boom South Park is a nice slice of tranquil heaven in the middle of a rather busy area.  Mexico au Parc is a delicious spot when you cash goes far and quality is not spared.  My friends call me the bottom less pit since I seem to eat 24-7 and their Quesadillas even fill me up.  Ever order come with chips and the salsa is fresh and ranges from mild to burn-your-mouth-good.  I am normally not a huge fan of Mexican cuisine but the food here has made a believer out of me, the enchiladas are to DIE for.  The people are quick and friendly and even during the lunch time rush you can get in, get you food, and get out in 10 minutes and generally spend less the 7 bucks for your meal AND a drink.  There is something nice about coke in a glass bottle.  The restaurant is not REALLY set-up for a lot of in house dinning but there is a lovely park right out side.  Most of the portions are so generous half fills you up and then you have a nice snack for later.  If you are in South Park, GO HERE.
author: Amy P.

description: Fresh, clean, nice atmosphere with good food and I really like the salsas they put out. A good deal as well.
author: Arptro H.

description: this is a very solid restaurant/taqueria.  as for the items i go for veggie super and meat quesadillas.  it is a solid option for lunch that's for sure.  lately i've been relying more on the super veggie for daily sustenance.  reason being, $4.50 2 meals.  good value.  there is nothing spectacular about this place though.  i think one of the reasons it does deserve 4 stars is the consistency and obvious value.  lack of similar taquerias in the area might have influenced me though.
author: Anthony Y.
